newsitem.title: INDIA: U.S. Specialty in India clinical lab joint venture.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Specialty in India clinical lab joint venture.

text.p: U.S. clinical testing firm Specialty Laboratories Inc and an Indian pharmaceutical major on Friday announced a 50-50 joint venture.
California-based Specialty's chairman James Peter told a news conference the Indian venture would be his firm's first overseas laboratory.
Specialty Ranbaxy's clinical laboratory will be inaugurated on Saturday at a Bombay suburb.
Peter said two satellite laboratories will be built in Bangalore in the south and New Delhi, India's capital, later this year.
Specialty's sophisticated facilities would take less time to detect tuberculosis compared to existing Indian diagnosis, he said.
Specialty is initially investing 250 million rupees.
Specialty officials said joint ventures are planned in Malaysia and the People's Republic of China in the near future.
Peter said the joint venture would also undertake research in medical problems peculiar to India in collaboration with Indian research institutions.
